data.title: Competitive Innovations in 10th: Night of the Living Deathwing pt.2
data.meta_description: Will there be fewer Dark Angels this time? No, no there won’t. Greg is hooting and hollering just off screen. Anyway, we have had some regretable technical issues that have preventedÂ Lowest oâ¦

& Crucible of Malediction (on Char2: Haemonculus)

1x Raider (80 pts): Bladevanes, Dark Lance

Thoughts

There tends to be exactly one reason you’d stick to Realspace Raiders over Skysplinter, and sure enough there are six Talos here. At that point, you absolutely want access to -1 to Wound against incoming damage, and combining with their 5+ Feel No Pain for effective defence against almost everything.

I’m going to be real here – I’m writing this in a hurry, I can’t find out what mission it was, and the scoreline is not close – this is an absolutelyÂ horrific matchup for the Chaos Knights. The Drukhari have the guns to clear War Dogs at speed, good amount of threat redundancy, defence in depth via their Transports, and the extra pain tokens from the detachment are honestly super useful so you can get early re-rolls on all the Talos to unleash haywire hell. I am quite genuinely unsure what you even do as the Knights here beyond hoping the Drukhari mess up badly. They clearly did now.

Result

Drukhari (Realspace Raiders) Victory – 93 – 53

Pháº¡m XuÃ¢n Thá»§y – Drukhari (Realspace Raiders) – 1st Place

The List

See Showdown

Archetype

Talos Spam

Thoughts

Skysplinter is clearly still the standout option for Drukhari, but seeing an event win for Realspace does make you stop and evaluate how Talos sit in the current metagame, and they honestly look pretty great. T7 with access -1 to Wound is a great place to be against Blood Angels, twin-linked haywire is fantastic into some key targets, and the rise of Deathwing Knights makes D3 melee weapons premium. I am officially declaring them “neat”, and congratulations to Pháº¡m on making them work.

The Best of the Rest

There were 7 more players on 4-1 records. They were:

2nd – Vinh Tran – Chaos Knights (Traitoris Lance):Â See Showdown.

3rd – Jensen Goh – Death Guard (Plague Company): Plague Marine Rhinos, Destructors, a massive Poxwalker unit and a Knight Lancer for style points.

4th – Carlos Trinh – Imperial Knights (Noble Lance): Canis Rex, a bunch of Armigers and some Assassins.

5th – Viet Pham Hoang – Death Guard: Plague Marine Rhinos, Deathshrouds and some War Dogs.

6th – Victor Koh – Adepta Sororitas (Hallowed Martyrs): Some top all-rounder Sisters hits plus Canis Rex.

7th – Duy Nguyen – Death Guard: Crunchier Death Guard withÂ lots of Deathshrouds, some Bloat-Drones and some War Dogs.

8th – Dickson Chow- Thousand Sons:Â Double Mutalith Tsons.

The Carolina Open Hosted by Away Games

34-player, 5-round Grand Tournament in Carthage, NC, United States on July 27 2024. All the lists for this event can be found in Best Coast Pairings.

Austin Wingfield – Adepta Sororitas (Hallowed Martyrs) – 1st Place
